column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of TiSe2 were synthesized by solid state reaction with a Ti:Se ratio of 1:2.02.
#Text=The excess Se was added to compensate for the partial evaporation inherent during synthesis.
#Text=The samples were sealed in quartz ampoules under partial Argon atmosphere and heated at 50◦C/hr to 650◦C, followed by a 48 hour dwell at this temperature.
#Text=Subsequently, the samples were either cooled at different rates, or annealed at different temperatures or different times under partial Argon atmosphere.
#Text=TiSe2 single crystals were grown by chemical vapor transport with I2 as the transport agent.
#Text=Ground elemental Ti and Se were sealed in quartz tubes with a ratio of 1:2.02 and 5 mg/cm3 of iodine.
#Text=The tubes were then placed in a 550◦C - 650◦C temperature gradient and held for 14 days, followed by controlled cooling to room temperature.
